articles.description: Follow in-play clips, radio commentary and live text updates from day two of the Ryder Cup at the Marco Simone Golf and Country Club, Rome.
articles.title: Ryder Cup: Europe aim to extend lead over US - clips, radio and text

articles.description: Europe's Ludvig Aberg and Viktor Hovland inflict the heaviest defeat in Ryder Cup history on the US pair of Scottie Scheffler and Brooks Koepka.
articles.title: Aberg & Hovland record biggest-ever Ryder Cup win

articles.description: Follow live commentary & text updates from fixtures across the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Build up to Aston Villa v Brighton followed by seven more matches

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary and follow text updates as Motherwell welcome Celtic in the first of six Scottish Premiership games.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership: Motherwell host Celtic in first of six games

articles.description: Are Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's powers fading? Is Jermell Charlo a compelling underdog? Steve Bunce answers those questions in his column.
articles.title: 'Alvarez the oldest 33-year-old in boxing history'

articles.description: France captain Antoine Dupont is cleared to return following an operation on a fractured cheekbone.
articles.title: Dupont cleared to return from fractured cheekbone

articles.description: Viktor Hovland and Ludvig Aberg storm to a record Ryder Cup victory that leaves world number one Scottie Scheffler in tears as Europe surged further ahead.
articles.title: Record win helps Europe dominate US in Ryder Cup

articles.description: The Women's Super League returns on Sunday - here is everything you need to know before the new season.
articles.title: Most competitive yet? All you need to know as WSL returns

articles.description: Chelsea agree a deal worth more than £40m with a United States-based sports technology company to become the new front of shirt sponsor.
articles.title: Chelsea agree £40m-plus shirt sponsor deal

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says Premier League players cannot cope with the demands placed on them as injuries mount up.
articles.title: 'Players can't deal any more with this overload'
